BVB CEO Hans-Joachim Watzke, “You have to talk about the role of the glorious club FC Barcelona.

Watzke, "On Thursday, we had a meeting with Barça. On Friday, Dembele went AWOL from training. You can guess what happened.”

Watzke, “Two weeks ago, I considered Barça a great and respectable club. Today, I have to say I’m no longer sure about that.”

Watzke: “I see the transfer probability of Ousmane Dembele under 50 percent.”

Watzke: "The amount of the fee you hear in the newspapers is not true. Is it higher? No comment."

Watzke: "Dembélé is option number 1 for Barcelona. They know that Dembélé is an excellent player."

Watzke: "I'm 100% sure Dembélé wouldn't have done this for any other club in the world. He has a affinity for Barcelona."

Watzke: "If Dembélé returns, he must apologize to the club in front of all the team members."

In recent weeks, Benedikt Höwedes appears to have fallen out completely with new coach Domenico Tedesco. The 29-year-old German who was a star at the last World Cup has since been stripped of his captaincy and been transfer listed by Schalke, who say that €20M will win his signature.
Not only will Klopp be well aware of Höwedes’ quality from his time in Germany, but he will also know that the centre half was Joël Matip’s defensive partner for seven seasons while both players were starring for the Bundesliga side, with both player’s graduates of Schalke’s youth team.
